Line 54: Line 54:
Lisa was relieved when Belle's time at private school came to an end. She went there initially because [[Rosemary King]] realised how intelligent Belle was and offered to pay the fees. Anything else - from the uniform to school trips - were to be funded by the Dingles. Unfortunately when Rosemary left the village, she stopped paying the fees and it was a struggle for Zak and Lisa to pay them. They borrowed a lot of money from Debbie, leading her to get into trouble with Carl, who she borrowed the money from.
Lisa was relieved when Belle's time at private school came to an end. She went there initially because [[Rosemary King]] realised how intelligent Belle was and offered to pay the fees. Anything else - from the uniform to school trips - were to be funded by the Dingles. Unfortunately when Rosemary left the village, she stopped paying the fees and it was a struggle for Zak and Lisa to pay them. They borrowed a lot of money from Debbie, leading her to get into trouble with Carl, who she borrowed the money from.
â
After Zak quit his job at [[List of residences in Emmerdale#Home Farm|Home Farm]], following a row over breakages Matthew insisted Zak pay for, Belle's friends found out that Zak hadn't paid the fees and teased her about it. So, recognising the problem, Zak and Lisa removed her from that school and she has returned to the local primary school.
+
After Zak quit his job at Home Farm, following a row over breakages Matthew insisted Zak pay for, Belle's friends found out that Zak hadn't paid the fees and teased her about it. So, recognising the problem, Zak and Lisa removed her from that school and she has returned to the local primary school.
Lisa has also managed to create a bond between Debbie and her daughter, Sarah. Andy agreed to let the Dingles see Sarah regularly and by getting Debbie to visit at the same time as Sarah and play with her, a mother-daughter bond is starting to develop. Sarah thinks Jo is her mum but enjoys spending time with Debbie.
Lisa has also managed to create a bond between Debbie and her daughter, Sarah. Andy agreed to let the Dingles see Sarah regularly and by getting Debbie to visit at the same time as Sarah and play with her, a mother-daughter bond is starting to develop. Sarah thinks Jo is her mum but enjoys spending time with Debbie.
